SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Synchronize Cart Details between Visualforce Pages and Experience Builder

The B2B Commerce Header component for an Experience Builder site provides updated functionality for the cart icon, which synchronizes with other cart enhancements to provide a consistent buyer experience.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, the B2B Commerce Header component for an Experience Builder site provided only a static cart icon. The icon only linked to your storefront's Shopping Cart page, and didn't summarize the cart's items and subtotal.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the B2B Commerce Header component's cart icon includes the following enhancements:

When you enable Cart Scale, a refresh icon displays while asynchronous logic reprices the cart's price data when the cart contains a large number of items.
A new browser cookie, LSKey[c]currCartId, that specifies the encrypted ID for the guest buyer's active cart when the buyer browses an Experience Builder site. When the buyer navigates to a Visualforce storefront page, the apex__currCartId cookie—used in previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce—continues to specify the same cart ID. Both cookies are created and set simultaneously, no matter which context—Visualforce page or Experience Builder site—is established first.
SEE ALSO
Scale Your Cart Capabilities for a Large Number of Items
Allow a B2B Commerce for Visualforce Guest Buyer to Maintain a Cart
Browser Cookies Set by B2B Commerce for Visualforce

title: Synchronizing Cart Details in B2B Commerce
